title: Cedar
text: The fragrant, finely grained, soft, brittle, very light, pinkish to brownish red heartwood is very durable, even in contact with soil. Because of its resistance to decay, fence posts are fashioned from the wood. Moths avoid the aromatic wood, and therefore it is in demand as lining for clothes chests and closets, which are often denominate. If correctly prepared, excellent English longbows, flatbows, and Native American sinew-backed bows can be made from it.
